COMMON.CRM_DESCRIPTION: SalesInnova is a CRM system that helps businesses manage customer interactions

PRICE_BOOK.PRICE_BOOK_REMOVE_CONFIRM: Are you sure you want to delete this price book?

FILES.SHARE_FILE_CONFIRM: Are you sure you want to share this file?

ERROR.INVALID_MOBILE_VIETNAMESE: Invalid mobile number, must be 10 digits and start with 0. After 0, the next number must be 3, 5, 7, 8, 9

CONFIRM.RESTORE: Are you sure you want to restore this record?

GUIDELINE.ADD_AND_EDIT_PRODUCTS_ON_OPP: Add and Edit Products on Opportunities
GUIDELINE.MOVE_AN_OPP_TO_THE_NEXT_STAGE: Move an Opportunity to the Next Stage
GUIDELINE.LEADS_CONTENT_1: Track prospects apart from your contacts and opportunities with Saleslnova lead records. After you’ve qualified your lead records, convert them to contacts and create accounts for them (if you don’t already have the accounts in Saleslnova). And hopefully, create opportunities to bolster your pipeline.
GUIDELINE.LEADS_CONTENT_2: Associate relevant events and tasks with those leads. And convert your qualified leads to contacts that have opportunities associated to them. For any lead records that you mark Unqualified, plan to revisit them later to see whether those prospects’ needs for your products and services changed.

LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.NAVIGATE_TO_LEADS_CONTENT: From the Saleslnova dashboard, click on the “Leads” tab in the main sidebar.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.LEAD_OVERVIEW_CONTENT: You will be redirected to the Lead Overview page where you can see all your leads listed in a table format or kanban format.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.FILTER_CONTENT: Use filter options to quickly find specific leads. You can filter by status, lead name, email, and more.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.LEAD_DETAILS_CONTENT: Click on a lead’s name to view detailed information including contact details, lead specific information, activities (log a call, event, email)
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.LEAD_STATUS_CONTENT: Monitor the status of each lead, which may include stages such as Unqualified, New, Working, Nurturing, Converted. Update the status as needed to reflect the current state of the lead.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.ACTION_CONTENT: Perform actions like editing, converting, or deleting leads directly from the overview page. Use the action buttons provided in the lead table.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.CREATE_NEW_LEAD_CONTENT: Click on the “New Lead” button to add a new lead to the system. Fill out the required fields such as lead name, company, and contact information,...
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.UPDATE_LEAD_CONTENT: Select a lead from the list and click “Edit” to update its details. Make sure to save changes to keep the lead information up-to-date.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.CONVERT_LEAD_CONTENT: Once a lead is qualified, use the “Convert” button to transform the lead into an account, contact, or opportunity.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.SELECT_THE_LEAD_TO_CONVERT_CONTENT_1: In the "Leads" tab, locate the qualified lead you wish to convert. You can use the search bar or filters to find the lead quickly.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.SELECT_THE_LEAD_TO_CONVERT_CONTENT_2: Click on the lead's name to open the lead record.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.REVIEW_LEAD_DETAILS_CONTENT: Ensure that all information related to the lead is accurate and up-to-date. This includes contact information, lead source, and any notes or attachments that are relevant.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.CLICK_ON_THE_CONVERT_BUTTON_CONTENT: On the lead record page, find and click the "Convert" button. This button is usually located in the top right corner of the page or under the "Lead Status" dropdown.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.COMPLETE_THE_CONVERSION_FORM_CONTENT: A conversion screen will appear, where you need to provide additional information
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.COMPLETE_THE_CONVERSION_FORM_CONTENT_ACC: Account: Choose to create a new account or select an existing account.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.COMPLETE_THE_CONVERSION_FORM_CONTENT_CON: Contact: Choose to create a new contact or select an existing contact. The contact will be associated with the account.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.COMPLETE_THE_CONVERSION_FORM_CONTENT_OPP: Opportunity: You can choose to create a new opportunity or skip this step if not applicable. Fill in opportunity details such as stage, close date, and amount.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.REVIEW_AND_CONFIRM_CONTENT_1: Review the information you have provided. Ensure all required fields are completed and accurate.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.REVIEW_AND_CONFIRM_CONTENT_2: Click the "Convert" button to complete the process.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.UPDATE_LEAD_STATUS_CONTENT: Ensure that the original lead record is marked as "Converted" or updated accordingly to reflect its new status.
LEAD_CONTENT_GUI.FINAL: By flilowing these guidelines, users can effectively manage leads and optimize their sales processes within Saleslnova. For further assistance, refer to Saleslnova’s documentation or contact your system administrator.

ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.ACCOUNT_CONTENT: Manage information about organizations, companies, or customers. From this screen, you can create, view, edit, and manage accounts, as well as track related activities.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.ACCESS: Access: Navigate to the Accounts tab from the main navigation bar.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.DETAILS: Details: The list of accounts will display basic information such as account name, industry, and status.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.ENTER_INFOR: Enter Information: Fill in the necessary details such as account name, address, phone number, email, industry, and any additional information.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.SAVE: Save: Click Save to store the new account information.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.SELECT_ACCOUNT: Select Account: From the account list, choose the account you want to edit.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.UPDATE_INFOR: Update Information: Make the required changes to the information.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.SAVE_UPDATE: Save: Click Save to apply the changes.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.SELECT_ACCOUNT_DETAIL: Select Account: From the account list, choose the account to view details.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.VIEW_INFOR: View Information: Tabs such as Details, Related, and Activity will provide detailed information about the account, related opportunities, and recent activities.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.SELECT_DELETE: Select Account: From the account list, choose the account you want to delete.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.CONFIRM: Confirm: Confirm the deletion when prompted.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.FILTER: Filter: Use filters to search and display accounts by criteria such as industry, status, or location.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.TRACK_ACTIVITIES: Track Activities: Use the Activity tab to monitor activities related to the account, including calls, emails, and meetings.
ACCOUNT_GUIDELINE.ASSIGN: Assign Accounts: Assign accounts to different teams or users within the organization for more effective management.

CONTACT.CONTACT_CONTENT: Allows you to manage information about individuals who are in contact with your organization. From this screen, you can create, view, edit, and manage contacts, as well as track related activities.
CONTACT.ACCESS: Access: Navigate to the Contacts tab from the main navigation bar.
CONTACT.DETAILS: Details: The list of contacts will display basic information such as contact name, company, and job title.
CONTACT.ENTER_INFOR: Enter Information: Fill in the necessary details such as contact name, email, phone number, company, job title, and any additional information.
CONTACT.SAVE_NEW: Save: Click Save to store the new contact information.
CONTACT.SELECT_CONTACT: Select Contact: From the contact list, choose the contact you want to edit.
CONTACT.UPDATE_INFOR: Update Information: Make the required changes to the information.
CONTACT.SAVE_UPDATE: Save: Click Save to apply the changes.
CONTACT.SELECT_DETAIL: Select Contact: From the contact list, choose the contact to view details.
CONTACT.VIEW_INFOR: View Information: Tabs such as Details, Related, and Activity will provide detailed information about the contact, related opportunities, and recent activities.
CONTACT.SELECT_DELETE: Select Contact: From the contact list, choose the contact you want to delete.
CONTACT.CONFIRM_DELETE: Confirm: Confirm the deletion when prompted
CONTACT.FILTER: Filter: Use filters to search and display contacts by criteria such as company, job title, or location.
CONTACT.TRACK: Track Activities: Use the Activity tab to monitor activities related to the contact, including calls, emails, and meetings.
CONTACT.ASSIGN: Assign Contacts: Assign contacts to different teams or users within the organization for more effective management.

OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.OPPORTUNITY_CONTENT: An Opportunity represents a potential revenue-generating deal for your company with a specific customer. Effective Opportunity management allows you to track sales progress and accurately forecast revenue.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.CLICK_OPP: Click the "New" button: Create a new Opportunity by clicking the "New" button.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.OPP_NAME: Opportunity Name: Name the Opportunity in a way that is easy to identify
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.ACCOUNT_NAME: Account Name: Link the Opportunity to a customer account.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.STAGE: Stage: Select the current stage of the Opportunity (e.g., "Prospecting", "Proposal/Price Quote").
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.AMOUNT: Amount: Enter the expected revenue from the Opportunity.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.OWNER: Owner: Assign the Opportunity to the person responsible.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.CLICK_SAVE: Click "Save": Save the Opportunity to start tracking it.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.PROSPECTING: Prospecting: The initial step, identifying potential customers.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.QUALIFICATION: Qualification: Determine the customer’s needs and whether they align with your product/service.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.NEED_ANALYSIS: Needs Analysis: Analyze the customer’s specific needs.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.PROPOSAL: Proposal/Price Quote: Send a proposal or price quote to the customer.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.CLOSE_WON: Closed Won: The customer agrees, and the deal is finalized.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.CLOSE_LOSE: Closed Lost: The deal didn’t go through, and the reason should be documented.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.UPDATE_OPP_CONTENT: Regularly update the Opportunity with the latest information
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.UPDATE_STAGE: Update the Stage: Adjust the stage of the Opportunity as the sales process progresses.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.ADD_PRODUCT: Add Products: Link the products or services the customer is interested in to the Opportunity.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.REVENUE_CONTENT: Saleslnova allows for revenue forecasting based on the Opportunities entered into the system. Ensure:
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.AMOUNT_ENTRY: Accurate Amount Entry: The amount should reflect the expected actual revenue.
OPPORTUNITY_GUIDELINE.CORRECT_CLOSE: Correct Close Date: Set the close date correctly to ensure accurate forecasting.

CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.CAMPAIGN_CONTENT: A Campaign in Saleslnova is a marketing initiative aimed at promoting a product, service, or brand to potential customers. Campaigns can be used to track and manage various marketing activities, such as email campaigns, events, webinars, and more. By leveraging campaigns, organizations can measure the effectiveness of their marketing efforts and optimize future strategies.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.CLICK_NEW: Click the "New" button: Start a new Campaign by clicking the "New" button.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.CAMPAIGN_NAME: Campaign Name: Provide a clear and descriptive name for the Campaign
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.TYPE: Type: Select the type of Campaign
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.STATUS: Status: Choose the current status (e.g., Planning, In Progress, Completed).
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.DATE: Start Date & End Date: Set the start and end dates for the Campaign.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.REVENUE: Expected Revenue: Estimate the potential revenue generated by this Campaign.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.COST: Actual Cost: Track the actual cost once the Campaign is completed.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.PARENT_CAMPAIGN: Parent Campaign: If applicable, link this Campaign to a Parent Campaign for better organization.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.CLICK_SAVE: Click "Save": Save the Campaign to begin tracking its progress.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.CAMPAIGN_MEMBER_CONTENT: Campaign Members are leads or contacts associated with a specific Campaign. To manage Campaign Members
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.ADDITION: Manual Addition: Click "Add Leads" or "Add Contacts" from the Campaign page.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.IMPORT_LEAD: Import from List: Use the "Manage Members" drop-down to import a list of leads or contacts.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.UPDATE_MEMBER: Update Member Status: Track the progress of Campaign Members by updating their status (e.g., Sent, Responded, Unsubscribed).
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.TRACKING_CAMPAIGN_CONTENT: Saleslnova allows you to monitor and analyze the effectiveness of your Campaign
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.ROI: Campaign ROI Analysis: Calculate the return on investment by comparing the Campaign’s revenue against its costs.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.INFLUENCE: Campaign Influence: Analyze how Campaigns impact Opportunities, attributing a percentage of Opportunity revenue to specific Campaigns.
CAMPAIGN_GUIDELINE.REPORT: Create Campaign Reports: Use Saleslnova reports to gain insights into Campaign performance, member engagement, and overall success.

PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.PRODUCT_CONTENT: A Product in Saleslnova is any item or service that your company sells to customers. Products are essential for managing sales processes, creating quotes, and tracking inventory. By organizing products in Saleslnova, you can streamline your sales operations, improve pricing accuracy, and enhance customer satisfaction.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.CLICK_NEW: Click on the "New" button to start creating a new product.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.PRODUCT_NAME: Product Name: Enter the name of the product.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.PRODUCT_CODE: Product Code: Enter a unique code to identify the product.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.PRODUCT_FAMILY: Product Family: Select the category or group the product belongs to.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.ACTIVE: Active: Check this box to make the product available for use in opportunities, quotes, and orders.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.DESCRIPTION: Description: Provide a detailed description of the product.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.CONTENT_1: Go to the "Price Books" tab to associate your product with a price book.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.CONTENT_2: Select or create a new price book by clicking "New".
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.CONTENT_3: Add the product to the price book by clicking "Add Products" in the price book's related list.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.CONTENT_4: Set the standard price for the product and any custom prices for specific customers or promotions.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.CONTENT_5: Click "Save" to finalize the price settings.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.USE_1: When creating or updating an opportunity, add products from the "Products" related list.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.USE_2: Choose the appropriate price book to pull in the correct pricing information.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.USE_3: Adjust the quantity and apply any discounts directly within the opportunity.
PRODUCT_GUIDELINE.FINAL: By following these guidelines, you can effectively manage your products in Saleslnova, leading to more organized sales processes and better alignment with your business goals.

PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.PRICE_BOOK_CONTENT: A Price Book in Saleslnova is a collection of products along with their prices. It allows you to manage pricing for different customer segments, regions, or sales channels. By using price books, your sales team can offer the right products at the right prices, ensuring accurate and consistent pricing throughout the sales process.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.CLICK_NEW: Click the "New" button to start creating a new price book.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.PRICE_BOOK_NAME: Price Book Name: Enter a descriptive name for the price book.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.DESCRIPTION: Description: Provide details about the price book, such as its intended use or target customer segment.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.ACTIVE: Active: Check this box to make the price book available for use in opportunities, quotes, and orders.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.CLICK_SAVE: Click "Save" to create the price book.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.ADD_PRODUCT: Adding Products to the Price Book
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.ADD_1: Open the newly created price book.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.ADD_2: In the "Price Book Entries" related list, click "Add Products."
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.ADD_3: Enter the list price for each product. This is the price that will be used when the product is added to an opportunity, quote, or order under this price book.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.ADD_4: Click "Save" to finalize the product entries.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.CUSTOM_1: Create custom price books to cater to specific customer segments, such as nonprofits, enterprises, or regional markets.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.CUSTOM_2: For each custom price book, set the appropriate list prices that reflect discounts, premium pricing, or other pricing strategies.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.CUSTOM_3: Ensure that all relevant products are added to the custom price books.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.USE_1: When creating or updating an opportunity, select the appropriate price book from the "Price Book" dropdown.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.USE_2: Add products from the selected price book to ensure that the correct prices are applied.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.USE_3: If necessary, adjust quantities and apply discounts directly within the opportunity.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.ACTIVE_1: Price books can be activated or deactivated based on your business needs.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.ACTIVE_2: Deactivate price books that are no longer in use to prevent confusion during the sales process.
PRICE_BOOK_GUIDELINE.FINAL: By following these guidelines, you can efficiently manage price books in Saleslnova, leading to accurate pricing, improved sales processes, and better alignment with your business objectives.

EMAIL_TEMPLATE.EMAIL_TEMPLATE_CONTENT: In Saleslnova, email templates are pre-formatted emails that can be customized and sent out to contacts, leads, or other recipients. They streamline communication by ensuring consistency in messaging and saving time when sending emails. This guideline will walk you through creating, updating, managing, and using email templates within Saleslnova.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.TEMPLATE_NAME: Template Name: A name to identify the template
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.FOLDER: Folder: Choose or create a folder where the template will be stored.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SUBJECT: Subject: The email subject line.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.RELATED: Related Entity Type: If applicable, choose the object (e.g., Lead, Contact) the email is related to.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.COMPOSE_1: In the email editor, you can write your email content, insert merge fields, and add images or links.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.COMPOSE_2: Use the formatting options to style the text.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SET_CONTENT: Define who can use the template by setting the appropriate folder and sharing settings.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.ACCESS_CONTENT: Make the necessary changes to the content, subject, or settings.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SAVE_CONTENT: Once your updates are complete, click "Save" to apply the changes.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.ORGANIZATION_1: Group your email templates into folders to keep them organized.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.ORGANIZATION_2: Use descriptive folder names to make it easy to find specific templates.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SHARE_1: Control access to your templates by setting folder permissions.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SHARE_2: You can share folders with specific users, roles, or groups.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SELECT_1: When composing an email from within Saleslnova, click "Insert, Create or Update Template."
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SELECT_2: Choose "Insert a Template" and select the desired template.
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SEND_1: Once you're satisfied with the email, click "Send" to dispatch it to the recipient.

CONTRACT.CONTRACT_CONTENT: In Saleslnova, contracts are used to formalize agreements between your company and its customers. This guideline will help you understand how to create, manage, and track contracts within Saleslnova.
CONTRACT.CLICK_NEW: Click on the "New" button to start creating a new contract.
CONTRACT.CONTRACT_NAME: Contract Name: Enter a descriptive name for the contract.
CONTRACT.ACCOUNT_NAME: Account Name: Select the account associated with this contract.
CONTRACT.START_DATE: Contract Start Date: Enter the start date of the contract.
CONTRACT.TERM: Contract Term: Specify the duration of the contract.
CONTRACT.END_DATE: Contract End Date: This will be auto-calculated based on the start date and term.
CONTRACT.STATUS: Status: Set the status of the contract (e.g., Draft, Active).
CONTRACT.PRICE_BOOK: Price Book: Select the price book associated with the contract.
CONTRACT.OWNER: Contract Owner: The user responsible for the contract.
CONTRACT.EDIT_1: Locate and click on the contract you want to view or edit.
CONTRACT.EDIT_2: To edit, click "Edit," make the necessary changes, and click "Save."
CONTRACT.ADD_2: Scroll down to the "Contract Line Items" related list.
CONTRACT.ADD_4: Select the product and enter the quantity and price.
CONTRACT.ATTACH_2: Click "Upload Files" to attach documents related to the contract.
CONTRACT.FINAL: This guideline will help you effectively create, manage, and track contracts within Saleslnova, ensuring that all agreements are well-organized and easily accessible.

ORDER.ORDER_CONTENT: In Saleslnova, orders represent the formalization of sales and are used to track the products and services sold to customers. This guideline will assist you in creating, managing, and tracking orders in Saleslnova.
ORDER.CLICK_NEW: Click on the "New" button to start creating a new order.
ORDER.ORDER_NAME: Order Name: Enter a descriptive name for the order.
ORDER.ACCOUNT_NAME: Account Name: Select the account associated with this order.
ORDER.ORDER_DATE: Order Date: Enter the date when the order was placed.
ORDER.CONTRACT: Contract: Select the contract related to this order, if applicable.
ORDER.PRICE_BOOK: Price Book: Select the price book used for this order.
ORDER.STATUS: Status: Set the status of the order (e.g., Draft, Activated).
ORDER.OWNER: Order Owner: The user responsible for managing the order.
ORDER.ADD_1: Scroll down to the "Order Products" related list.
ORDER.ADD_3: Select the product from the list, enter the quantity, and specify the unit price.
ORDER.ADD_4: Click "Save" to add the product to the order.
ORDER.SAVE_CONTENT: After adding all necessary details and products, click "Save" to create the order.
ORDER.VIEW_1: Locate and click on the order you want to view or edit.
ORDER.VIEW_2: To edit, click "Edit," make the necessary changes, and click "Save."
ORDER.TRACK_1: Update the status of the order as it progresses (e.g., Draft, Activated, Shipped).
ORDER.TRACK_2: Use custom fields or workflows to manage specific order states or processes.
ORDER.EDIT_2: To add products, use the "Add Product" button in the "Order Products" related list.
ORDER.EDIT_3: To remove products, click "Edit" on the product line item and then delete the item if needed.
ORDER.FINAL: By following this guideline, you can effectively manage orders in Saleslnova, ensuring that all sales transactions are accurately tracked and processed.

QUOTE.QUOTE_CONTENT: In Saleslnova, quotes are used to present pricing and terms to customers based on opportunities. This guideline will help you create, manage, and send quotes effectively.
QUOTE.CREATE_2: Scroll down to the "Quotes" related list and click "New Quote."
QUOTE.QUOTE_NAME: Quote Name: Enter a descriptive name for the quote.
QUOTE.OPP: Opportunity: Ensure the opportunity is correctly linked.
QUOTE.QUOTE_DATE: Quote Date: Enter the date when the quote is created.
QUOTE.EX_DATE: Expiration Date: Set the date when the quote will expire.
QUOTE.STATUS: Status: Choose the status (e.g., Draft, Approved).
QUOTE.TAX: Tax: Enter any applicable tax amount.
QUOTE.ADD_2: Select the product from the list, enter the quantity, and specify the unit price.
QUOTE.ADD_3: Click "Save" to add the product to the quote.
QUOTE.VIEW_1: Find and click on the quote you wish to view or edit.
QUOTE.VIEW_2: To edit, click "Edit," make the necessary changes, and click "Save."
QUOTE.UPDATE_2: Change the status as needed (e.g., Draft, Approved, Sent).
QUOTE.PDF_1: Click on "Generate PDF" to create a downloadable version of the quote.
QUOTE.PDF_2: Review the PDF to ensure all details are correct.
QUOTE.FINAL: By following this guideline, you will be able to create, manage, and send quotes effectively in Saleslnova, helping to streamline the sales process and improve customer engagement.

CONFIG.LEAD_STATUS_INDEX_NUMBER: Lead Status Index must be a number
CONFIG.OPPORTUNITY_STAGE_INDEX_NUMBER: Opportunity Stage Index must be a number
